abstract: If Apple likes a developer’s application, the company will play it up big. This is publicity that money cannot buy.
snippet: If Apple likes a developer’s application, the company will play it up big. This is publicity that money cannot buy.
lead_paragraph: MITCHELL WAITE could think of only one reason that Apple’s legal department would leave a voice message last February asking him to call back: he was about to be sued. Mr. Waite has a tiny software company bearing his name  it has no full-time employees  whose principal product is a field guide to birds called iBird Explorer, which runs on the iPhone and the iPod Touch.

headline.main: Shooting to Software Stardom on the iPhone
headline.print_headline: Shooting to Software Stardom on the iPhone
